title: Are Arab Muslims today’s ancestors Christians or Jews? - Quora

response.answer_text: The original Arabs were mostly descended from pagans. But part of converting to Islam in the early decades was being adopted into an Arabic group, so there are likely lots of Arabs descended from Christians who converted. Some may have Jewish ancestry but Jews generally were not prone to convert.

It is my understanding that the Arabs were mostly pagan before Mohamed converted them. The religion started in an area that was neither Christian nor Jewish. They just had scattered settlements/trading posts.

Arabs generally are descendants from Prophet Ishmael (Ismail in Arabic) peace be upon him. Some of them became pagans when paganism was introduced, some converted to Judaism or Christianity when they were heard of. So…
Both. Countries like Yemen, Lebanon, Syria, Egypt and Iraq had well established Jewish and Christian people, prior to Jihad. Mind you, Islam flourished by destroying the former Abrahamic Religions.

Do you mean the Arabs as the people speaking Arabic like in Egypt and Syria and Palestine for example? then Yes.if you mean the Arabs from the Arabian peninsula then some of them were and some were pagans
Arabs and Jews are Semites, descended from Shem via Abraham. Jews are descended from Isaac & Ismael. Arabs are descended from Ismael & Isaac.
